definition: to be employed/to be in post/on-the-job
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)

sentences.english: Don’t shy away from talking to people. Connect or reconnect with people who are still employed.
sentences.chinese: 不要羞于跟人讨论，与在职的人保持密切的联系。

sentences.english: So tell me about on the job training .
sentences.chinese: 请告诉我在职训练的一些事情吧。

sentences.english: At Gawker, it is not uncommon for editors to stay on the job for just a year.
sentences.chinese: 在高科，编辑仅仅在职一年是很常见的。

sentences.english: In addition, it also emphasizes training of managers.
sentences.chinese: 伊利也注重对在职干部的培养。

sentences.english: One of the few things that has not changed in business is first impressions.
sentences.chinese: 在职场上没有改变的少数事情之一就是第一印象。

sentences.english: His term as president was tumultuous.
sentences.chinese: 他在职总统期间可谓波澜起伏。

sentences.english: In a few companies, interviewing for a new job is considered tantamount to treason.
sentences.chinese: 少数公司认为在职员工面试其他工作等于叛变。

sentences.english: Bright red, black, or jeweled nails are not appropriate for the workplace.
sentences.chinese: 亮红色，黑色，或闪闪的指甲在职场上都是不合适的。

sentences.english: The best workers are well-rounded professionals with full lives, in and out of the office.
sentences.chinese: 最好的员工在职场内外都有丰富多彩的生活。

sentences.english: That is why they use on-the-job training , or OJT .
sentences.chinese: 这就是为什么他们都采用在职培训的原因。

sentences.english: I am not the teaching staff or alumni of Po Leung Kuk Laws Foundation College.
sentences.chinese: 本人并非保良局陆庆涛小学之在职教员或校友。

sentences.english: There is evidence that the younger generation of women is thriving in the workplace.
sentences.chinese: 有迹象显示，年轻一代的女性在职场上很吃得开。

sentences.english: I learned from your ad that you will provide on-the-job training for new employees.
sentences.chinese: 我从你们的广告上得知，你们为新雇员提供在职培训。

sentences.english: There are 50 personnel in this company, including 30 on-job postgraduates.
sentences.chinese: 这个公司有50个人，包括30个在职研究生。

sentences.english: The lack of balanced capactiy is the main reason why most of people cease to advance in their workplace.
sentences.chinese: 缺少平衡力是大部分人在职场上止步不前的重要原因。

sentences.english: I was impressed with the company's emphasis on in-service training.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司对员工在职训练的重视，令我印象深刻。

definition: workplace/workforce (of a nation or industry etc)/job market
main job/day job/steady full-time job (as opposed to temporary or casual)/chief or principal post (as opposed to deputy)
higher education record/record including Master's or Doctoral degree
